Since the 1960s, the intake of n-3 fatty acids has decreased while n-6 fatty acids have increased [46]. 
Experimental studies in animals suggest that n-3 fatty acids reduce the risk of macrosomia by lowering 
hyperlipidemia levels and restoring antioxidant status and immune function [94]. Beneficial effects of n-3 fatty
